response.headline: Bukhansan National Park hiking routes and tips from Doseonsa Temple to Ranger Station
response.summary: Three main hiking routes in Bukhansan National Park: Doseonsa Temple route (shortest/easiest on eastern side), Bukhansan Fortress Entrance with trail split options, and Fortress to Ranger Station via Baegundae (thru-hike across park). Take Ui-Sinseol Line to Bukhansan Ui Station, then taxi (15 min) or walk (1 hour). Hike takes under 3 hours round trip. Gear rental available from Seoul Hiking Tourism Center.

extracted_text: Shortest & easiest route on the eastern side of the park
Trail splits halfway: choose longer-but-easier or shorter-but-steeper
We did the Doseonsa Temple route
Took the Ui-Sinseol Line to Bukhansan Ui Station
Taxi to trailhead (15 min), or walk (1 hour along the road)
Hike time: under 3 hours round trip
Rented gear from Seoul Hiking Tourism Center
We hiked down, ate Korean BBQ at Sununsan Mountain Range
image_details.key_interest: Detailed hiking route information and transportation logistics for Bukhansan National Park
